Mano Borszeki

CYMATRA

A brand identity for a cybersecurity startup. Combining new technology with traditional physical signals to keep your data safe.

https://readymag.website/u2876732949/5544701/

Instagram: mano.borszeki

Valinnie Crasto

There's Food At Home

In a world of movement and migration, the definition of home has become rather personal and layered. For some people, home may be a physical place, for others, it’s a memory, a person, a scent or even food. Is home considered a simple location, or is it more than this? Does it move with us and live within small parts of our daily lives? "There's Food At Home' is an embroidered tablecloth & publication exploring the connection between home, migration and how food can evoke memories of this. The tablecloth symbolising a space of community, sharing and care for each other and the bringing together of different experiences.

valinnie.co.uk

Instagram: @valc.gd

Ruben Cook

https://readymag.website/u4009891215/5505437/

Instagram: -

Shangda Li

Are you Narcissus?

“Dissolve of ice —— is this reconciliation or another extreme indifference?” This is a photo poem in response to the labeling, misunderstanding and stereotyping I experienced during my research into the academic controversies surrounding “outsider art”, visualizing my personal experiences and the academic context into a photo poem. ———————————— Viewing shape of mist at noon, I cannot stop narcissus from splashing into golden fragments; while comforting my shy and brooding future.

https://readymag.website/u793806734/5456106/

Instagram: @shang.da.li

Belita Edi

Antimacassar

Emulating the form of what is made to prevent it – Antimacassar explores themes of wear, erosion, and our treatment of the objects we possess and handle. Materials bear the marks of time, contact, the conditions of the environments they inhabit, and the marks they obtain can carry the knowledge of those encounters. This publication looks at wear as an addition, not subtraction of value – a new presence in the absence of what was before. Through reflection on the ‘loved’ objects that surround us, Antimacassar suggests a kinder glance at their un-mint condition.

https://readymag.website/5499973

Instagram: @bygone.things

Willem Hayes

Relika

Relika is a collaborative project, aiming to bridge the gap between expression and academia through a visual narrative. Captivated by the history between collections/objects and their curators/owners. Bringing lost tales and forgotten understandings back to modern parchment to cultivate group understanding on the discrepancies within the diaspora of relics.

https://readymag.website/5524400

Instagram: @willemhayes

Nathan Priest

IT AY AS BAD AS THEY SAY CHAP

This publication is a collection of images taken from Google Street View of houses with special sentimental meaning to me throughout my hometown of Halesowen in Dudley. It acts as a reflection on my change of perspective of the West Midlands after three years living in London. I miss the accent, I miss the warmth of the people, I miss the battered chips (getting hungry just thinking about them...), and I miss my family. The book is made up of 11 sheets of A3 folded down to A5; when unfolded, they become double-sided posters (three-in-one). Dedicated to Mom and Dad

nathanpriest.cargo.site

Instagram: @nthanpriest

Liv Carter

Dream Job

This project explores how to bring more fun into work life by questioning the normalised pessimism around adulthood and jobs. By transforming ordinary office items into nostalgic, surreal objects, it asks what a dream job might look like. Optimism is hard to maintain, especially when adult goals like buying a house or finding fulfilling work feel unattainable. Our generation often tries to heal its inner child through consumerism, but this project explores how true healing can come from relearning how to play. The space uses colourful 2000s styles like Frutiger Aero and mediums ranging from riso printing to papier-mâché and ceramics.

https://olivecarter.hotglue.me/?Olive+Carter+

Instagram: olivecarters

Henry Bennett

Routine Movement

Routine Movement is a comment upon digitalizations impact on daily human life. Advancements in technology has led to humans being flooded with images on a daily basis, which has caused fragmented focus and repetitive behaviors. The project uses slower processes of making, like risography and screen printing, to highlight these repetitive behaviors and demonstrate how they can result in us taking in images more consciously and carefully in order to understand the world around us.

https://readymag.website/u2761169440/5500028/

Instagram: henrybennettt

Kristen Cheng

Fama

Fama is a typeface inspired by the traditional numbering system once found throughout Hong Kong. The name of the typeface itself is drawn from this very system, where Fama (花碼) refers to the distinctive, handwritten numerals that appeared on menus, price boards, and minibus fare signs. These characters, known for their fluid calligraphic strokes and hand-painted charm, embody the city’s unique visual language. As these markings gradually disappear amid modernisation, Fama seeks to preserve their essence and reimagine their aesthetic, offering a contemporary interpretation that honours their cultural

https://readymag.website/u4081545098/5488916/

Instagram: krispii10

Janaya Burrell

Language of Design

This piece offers an in-depth exploration of how specific language can subtly influence an individual's response to artwork, often on a subconscious level. Accompanying the work is a transformed academic essay presented as a zine, which delves into publishing processes and the art of conveying lived experience to an audience.

https://readymag.website/u3068674397/5535949/

Instagram: JBurrellArt

Kesiah Ide

Living, Breathing cute

Living breathing cute is a collection of short essays exploring the theme of ‘cute’ through the perspective of 9 young women. It challenges the common misconceptions of what ‘cuteness’ can be and reflections on each writers personal connection to cute. Typeset with ASCII designs that capture the spirit of cute. Accompanying the publication is a photographic book I produced which utilises macro photography to document a collection of 58 cute trinkets. Both publications are packaged together within the ‘adorable overload collection’ in which I printed a run of 24 of each publication, each photo book featuring a different cover.

Kesiah.co.uk

Instagram: @kesiah___

Maria Read

The Pixel pack

Pixel Circle Heavy is one of four weights in the Pixel Pack typeface, a digital font imagined through a physical lens. Inspired by the lost craft of lace-making and the discontinued Letra-set, this project blends delicate history with modern design. The square letterforms are inspired by lace patterns, forming a pixel-based visual language. In an age of boredom filled with screen time, Pixel Pack offers a tactile, entry-level design tool. Mimicking the Letra-set, it invites a slower, more playful way of making. Printed on sheer organza, hand-stitched lace trim. Get interactive! Use the Pixel Pack sticker sheets, add to the display .

https://readymag.website/u874042899/5500174/

Instagram: @pixlgirlwrld

Holly Snashall

HOLLD The Natural Collection

HOLLD is a sustainable brand transforming second hand clothing into one of a kind, wearable art by hand painting and screen-printing. More than just upcycling, the process is a celebration of creativity and self-expression promoting slow fashion and reduction of textile waste. All materials are recycled or sustainable - no mass production, no waste just art and reinvention. The Natural Collection draws from earth tones creating calm, organic foundations, transforming raw natural textures into artistic designs. By using mindful design and ethical practices this collection stands as a reminder that fashion can exist in harmony with the planet.

https://readymag.website/u2041613654/hollysnashall/

Instagram: @getholld

Honey Poland

Second Skin

Second Skin is a cyanotype series made by stretching worn tights onto acrylic sheets and exposing them in sunlight. The prints hold onto small details like ladders, creases, stretched seams - marks left behind by the body. Cropped and bound into two B4 hand-made photobooks, the work looks at the layers we wear and the ones we keep hidden. There’s a closeness in these textures, a quietness. What’s left behind says just as much as what’s shown, if not more.

https://readymag.website/u2758670704/5507236/

Instagram: honeypolanddesign

Sofia Akhtar

The Home I Don't Yet Know

“The Home I Don’t Yet Know” is a self-discovery project surrounding being a third-generation immigrant. As a Pakistani, mixed-race woman I have often felt separated from my homeland. I have never had the opportunity to visit Pakistan, and when being born and raised in England it can be hard to feel connected to my heritage. This project is an exploration of my ancestry and identity through traditional printing techniques and cultural archiving of family photos. The publication can be read either right-to-left to tell the story from my grandmother's perspective, or left-to-right to tell the story from my own perspective.

https://my.readymag.com/edit/5569843/preview/

Instagram: graph.icz

Betsy Cross

Mawgan Porth

This project is a personal reflection on my childhood summers in Mawgan Porth, Cornwall — a place that shaped so much of who I am. Through photographs and design, my project captures the rhythms, rituals and atmosphere of growing up by the sea. It’s about family, memory, and the beauty of the everyday. A quiet tribute to the people and the place that inspired it.

https://readymag.website/u1501960691/5517288/2/

Instagram: @betsyrcross

Dulant Pang

Everybody Moves

Everybody Moves is a movement that reframes body image in fitness, encouraging people of all shapes, sizes, and experience levels to embrace movement. It uses animals as playful, inclusive metaphors to show that all forms of activity are valid. A system of custom modular shapes creates various animals, inviting personal and imaginative connections. This is paired with a bold, chunky typeface that complements the geometric forms, building a cohesive and welcoming visual language. The campaign challenges unrealistic fitness standards and celebrates movement as something everyone can enjoy in their own way.

https://dulant.co.uk/

Instagram: @dulantpang

Found Language

A reactionary approach to understanding the philosophies of the city. This work seeks to present the perception of urban space through language structures — highlighting the ways the city thinks for us, and speaks with us. Miaoting Mei

Home letter map

当然可以，这是一版更简洁的版本（约 75 字）： ⸻ Home Letter Map is an interactive visual novel about memory, migration, and cultural identity. Inspired by Taishan’s overseas Chinese heritage, it guides players through meaningful hometown sites—train stations, courtyards, food stalls—blending storytelling and reflection. Aimed at second-generation migrants and young workers away from home, the game reimagines family letters as a digital experience, inviting players to reconnect with their roots and explore what “home” truly means.

https://mei9707.cargo.site/

Instagram: Mei's design

Jade Slater

Unfolding Boundaries

This book unfolds not as single images but as a series of edges and intersections. Each image is a cross section, a point at which boundaries both merge and divide. We navigate junctions everyday - geographical, political, emotional - some visible, some left unseen. In this unfolding, they become both increasingly visible and fluid, thresholds merging into one another. Bound by the usual perimeters of which we encounter in our daily life, it is not often that these intersections are adjoined. There is importance in more closely noticing these divisions, where one thing ends and another begins.

https://readymag.website/u302797921/5500258/

Instagram: js_graphic.design

Isaac Prandy

FREE WORLD

A 68 page booklet made up of surveillance images taken from Insecam.org. Its title - a propaganda term - also derives from the availability and "freeness" of the visual material that I seek-out and use. In response to my research surrounding the function of images within systems of power and control; FREE WORLD is a voyeuristic montage of appropriated surveillance imagery that evokes an all-seeing, technological deity.

isaacprandy.com

Instagram: @isaac_prandy

Click on the arrows to navigate around the building, and click the ‘i’ icons for more information about the equipment available as part of the course. The virtual tour can be accessed in virtual reality, as well as via browser on any device, at: https://camberwellgraphicsvirtualtour.co.uk/

Created as a response to the pressures of perfection in modern society, Unfiltered encourages people to show up as their true selves, boldly and unapologetically. Through a mix of street and studio photography, thoughtful design, and reflective storytelling, the magazine explores how clothing becomes a tool for self-discovery and empowerment.

Emma Qiu

CTRL+ESC

Today, digital addiction has become so normalised that terms like "brainrot" and "doomscrolling" have entered our everyday vocabulary. Drawing from my own experiences and personal struggles with digital addiction, this installation explores how social media is deliberately engineered to captivate our attention and immerse us in an endless virtual reality. This is your life. What do you want to pay attention to?

emmaq.info

Chigbu Elechi-Igwe-Membere-Otaji

The Dehumanisation of A Child

This is a collection of three separate projects centred around the absurdity of child abuse. A book titled “The Cane Behind The Door And Other Weapons Fashioned Against Us” that details objects used by abusive caregivers to beat children. Three photographs from a bigger photography series titled “I Need To Have Never Existed!”, that communicates the mental state of an abused child. A photograph called “Only Dum Dums Abuse Children!”

N/A

Instagram: @uncleesther

YURUI WANG

CueMug

CueMug addresses the critical issue of kitchen fire risks caused by memory lapses among older adults. By embedding a gentle visual reminder into the handle of a daily-use mug, the design subtly links hydration with stove safety. The project combines behavioral psychology, inclusive design, and low-tech intervention to deliver a non-intrusive reminder system. CueMug represents a human-centered approach that prioritizes dignity, routine, and intuitive design—offering a practical solution to an often-overlooked yet dangerous domestic problem.

https://readymag.website/u3030991707/5520123/

Instagram: Yurik

Lily McCardle

Tenfold Knottiness

Tenfold Knottiness explores projections of ten-crossing prime knots- forms that, much like prime numbers, can't be simplified further. Of the 165 tenfold prime knots, this project presents a selection to showcase their structural variety. Each knot is both a topological object and a three-dimensional structure, revealing how repetition and modularity can drive generative variation. The knot projections are printed using a thermal receipt printer, emphasising the relationship between systematic repetition and the ephemeral nature of the material output.

https://readymag.website/5499991

Instagram: @lily.mccardle

Bailey

Advanced Search

Advanced Search is an exploration of the capabilities of AI-powered reverse image search algorithms, presented through 4000 saved images. The collection explores the nuanced relationship between human and AI image classification. As we teach AI to sort, generate, and organize visual media, its output teaches us to recognize unfamiliar, sometimes uncanny, patterns of visual association. We begin to subconsciously understand the intricacies of AI logic; the strange cohesion of images grouped not by subject, but by texture, lighting, compression artifacts, or other non-human priorities.

baileyfoot.xyz

Instagram: bailey.070

CueMug

Zosia Eastwood

Ways I See

‘Ways I See’ forms a poetry collection written by Patrycja Eastwood and designed by her daughter, Zosia Eastwood. Patrycja Eastwood emigrated to the UK from Poland in 1994 as a young adult. Despite her love of writing, she felt trapped between two languages. Years later, she now studies Creative Writing at university. 'Ways I See' symbolises the return to her favourite form of expression with confidence. The design of this book focuses on texture and feel, using by-hand practices such as letterpress to emphasise the importance of traditional print practices and finishes in the making of a meaningful publication.

https://readymag.website/u4021308619/Zosia/

Instagram: @im.ssyou_

Wiktoria Ploskonka

Said in Passing - Microaggression in the Everyday

An experience in a diverse city inspired this project as I realised how normalised microaggression is. I found that it is also a discussion often brought in professional settings, schools or work and is often not addressed in public settings. My ceramics tell the story of anonymously submitted experienced, the design mimics the experience by being concealed on the inside of the ceramics so the viewer is forced to interact with it when they eat or drink from it. This project aims to start dialogue to make people more aware of everyday microaggressions that once noticed can be challenged.

https://readymag.website/u3408923512/5500071/

Instagram: 678minia

Alisa Venelinova

Smultronställe

“Smultronställe” is a Swedish word which directly translated means “Wild strawberry place”. It is a special place where not many people go and can be anything from a bench in a park, to a small area in the forest where you always find chanterelles. A place you keep secret, or a place which holds sentimental value to you. Smultronställe is a publication with collection of photographs from some locals special places around Stockholm, Sweden. Photographed using Kodak ektar H35 half frame camera.

https://readymag.website/u3409465586/5500013/

Instagram: @ a_designsbyme

Lily MacKinnon

Re-Wired

RE-WIRED is an A-Z glossary of terms and interviews about the neurodivergent experience, made by and for neurodivergent people. We aim to amplify voices of young neurodivergent adults, this demographic often lacks representation and awareness. To create the visuals for the publication, we facilitated typography workshops with neurodivergent participants, asking them to design letters that reflected aspects of their neurodivergence. Alongside the visual content, this publication shares authentic narratives from various neurodivergent individuals about their journeys, providing support and insight to newly diagnosed neurodivergent people.

https://readymag.website/u2060838403/5514564/

Instagram: @lilymackinnon_design

Wenyi Wang

heyCup

HeyCup is a sensory-based community project that helps young people reconnect with their bodies and surroundings through touch, sound, and sight. By designing playful, low-pressure workshops, it gently restores presence in a fast-paced world.

wenyiwang.org

Instagram: Wene_Wang

Elena Greenway

Birth the GROOVE

This project explores the playful power of DIY instrument culture to make music-making more accessible and judgment-free. By crafting unconventional tools for rhythm and sound, Birth the Groove lowers the stakes of grooving in public—inviting everyone to move, play, and participate without fear. It’s not about being good; it’s about being in it.

https://readymag.website/u1395922430/5499980/9/

Instagram: @elenagreenway_design

Iman Ahsan

Ruh

Ruh: The Ritual Archive of South Asian Scent is a digital exploration of the sacred, cultural, and emotional role of scent across South Asia. Inspired by oral traditions and ancestral rituals, the project reimagines how smell can be documented in a digital space. Through interactive storytelling, minimalist design, and archival research, Ruh preserves disappearing rituals while inviting viewers to reflect on their own sensory memories. This project asks: how do we archive something as intangible as scent? Ruh offers a gentle, immersive response, where heritage is not only remembered, but felt through design.

https://readymag.website/u1066725230/5592411/

Instagram: Imanahsan_

George Underwood

Bridging the Metabolic Rift

This project explores the intersection of ecology and urban infrastructure, interrogating the perceived division between the natural world and the built environment. The urban landscape, thought to exclude nature, hosts it. Even in environments dominated by concrete and smog, nature bares its face. This collection highlights fauna quietly enduring beneath the architecture of progress. By observing the animals that persist despite anthropogenic climate change, we can close the gap. Under streetlights and between cracks in concrete, life teems, silent witnesses to our coexistence. Towers build not away from nature, but grow alongside it.

https://my.readymag.com/edit/5500821/preview/

Instagram: @kidleng

Angelica Dismas

Rib Cage - Matilda Cole (Visualizer)

The visualizer for indie pop artist Matilda Cole’s “Rib Cage”, from her EP Pomegranate, translates the song’s raw reflection on girlhood, legacy, and emotional inheritance into a dreamlike visual loop. Caught between innocence and transformation, the mixed media animation mirrors the inner struggles and cyclical nature of healing. Subtly inspired by the myth of Persephone, it explores descent and return through tarot-inspired cards that guide a symbolic journey through identity and womanhood.

https://readymag.website/u1437113357/AngelicaDismas/

Instagram: mypaperflora

Through immersive memory journeys, the film challenges viewers to reflect on technology, creativity, and the human spirit in a rapidly evolving world.

https://readymag.website/5540295

Enya O’Sullivan

Home is where the pub is

This project explores the relationship between football clubs and pubs, specifically the home pubs. For fans, there’s no better feeling than walking into a pub that’s drenched in their team’s memorabilia, surrounded by fans creating feeling of community and belonging. One thing brings these people together: the love for their team.   Focusing on 12 London teams, ranging from the Premier League to League Two, this project celebrates the places fans can find sanctuary before and after the game. Displaying beer mats, bottles and a scrapbook to create the familiar environment of a pub, here’s to these pubs and their clubs.

https://readymag.website/u3373982921/5500247/

Instagram: gdxenyaosullivan

RE-WIRED is an A – Z glossary of terms and interviews about the neurodivergent experience, made by and for neurodivergent people. We aim to amplify voices of young neurodivergent adults, this demographic often lacks representation and awareness. Alongside the visual content, this publication shares authentic narratives from various neurodivergent individuals about their journeys, providing support and insight to newly diagnosed neurodivergent people.

Zetong Chen

How Are You

How Are You is a playful communication card game designed to help language learners speak up, laugh, and mess up together. Through awkward scenarios and humorous polite responses, the game transforms language anxiety into connection, creativity and confidence. With its approachable design and flexible play modes, How Are You invites players to embrace imperfection, build fluency and enjoy the messy, joyful process of learning to speak.

https://zetooong.cargo.site/

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/yuriiiiiiiiz/

Olivia Chapman

Decoding Digtial Masculinity

Decoding Digital Masculinity examines the evolving landscape of gender identity in the digital age–a time where you can find an answer for anything, whether truthful or not–and presents how art and design could play a role in opening up conversation around this topic.  Through analysis of conversations taking place online, this book serves as an opening into further discussion off-screen and sheds light on an ever-present and deteriorating situation.

https://readymag.website/u3513969411/5500020/

Instagram: liv_chapmanxx
